meanings.definition: To cause to become dull or sluggish.
meanings.sent1: The long lecture was narcotizing, making the students struggle to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: The medication had a narcotizing effect on the patient, helping them relax.
meanings.sent3: The boring movie was so narcotizing that even the popcorn fell asleep.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous sound of the rain was narcotizing, lulling everyone into a dreamlike state.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive task was narcotizing, numbing the mind with its monotony.

meanings.definition: To have a sedative effect on.
meanings.sent1: The soothing music was narcotizing, calming the anxious child.
meanings.sent2: The anesthesia was narcotizing, ensuring the patient felt no pain during surgery.
meanings.sent3: The bedtime story had a narcotizing effect on the toddler, helping them drift off to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The gentle massage was narcotizing, easing the tension in the muscles.
meanings.sent5: The warm tea was narcotizing, bringing a sense of relaxation to the tired soul.
